metadata.title: CVE-2021-3802 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
A vulnerability found in udisks2. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted image file/USB leading to kernel panic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-udisks-2.0 - 2.9.4-1
libudisks2-0 - 2.9.4-1
udisks2 - 2.9.4-1
udisks2-bcache - 2.9.4-1
udisks2-btrfs - 2.9.4-1
udisks2-lvm2 - 2.9.4-1
udisks2-zram - 2.9.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: udisks2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.4-1').
